page.title: 14RAVELSTON HOUSE,EDINBURGH.
page.content: { Ravelston House}in 1685 was the home of Sir John Foulis and his eleven children so it knew the sound of children's voices. Today in 1985,it still rings with this sound,the children now being the pupils of the{Mary Erskine School}for Girls.In the basement are sewing rooms and kitchens,upstairs are music rooms and tucked under the roof is the equipment room of the Radio Club.Other rooms are used for language practice,a Fiction Library,VIth Form Common Room and a reception suite for important visitors. Alongside the house is the modern building that houses the rest of the school.It is surrounded by playing fields.From all points comes the sound of children's voices.Sir John would be pleased his home was still in use.
